intro: Glomeraria deflexa, commonly known as the bent-stemmed glomeraria, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a compact, low-growing habit. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the flowers are white or pale green, arranged in umbels. Glomeraria deflexa is often found in chaparral and grassland ecosystems.
